comments.body:
Sync will need something more descriptive.

Sync's main purpose is to suspend side effects, but his second purpose so to speak is to have a memory safe `flatMap`, meaning that you can describe `tailRecM` with it for example. It's actually the only type class in Cats that has this by law.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +9,13 @@# Sync

A `Monad` that can suspend the execution of side effects in the `F[_]` context.

```tut:book:silent
